Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Manc_Chaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pausania for 4 nights at the end of February. There are many nice looking hotels in Venice and it's easy to become inundated with options. We chose this one because it seemed decent for the price and was in a good location. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is set in a former palace and many of its features are quite old fashioned. This adds to its charm in my opinion. I disagree with previous reviewers claiming it to be shabby and run down. The grand stone staircase, the dark wooden panelled reception area and the large glass windows & chandeliers of the 2nd floor lounge complete with balcony overlooking the canal all add to the warm, homely feeling you can't help but get from the minute you walk through the door. Ok, modern it isn't but this is Venice after all. The rooms are comfortable and nicely furnished, without being anything to write home about. Perhaps a little on the small side if I was to complain about anything, as was the bathroom, but you don't visit Venice to stay in your room! Breakfast was served in the conservatory with a nice view out onto the garden. Access to the garden was closed off with it being winter but I would imagine this would be very pleasant in summertime. Breakfast itself wasn't the best and probably where the hotel gets marked down for me. Typical continental affair but the choice could have been bigger. We stayed in Rome prior to our trip to Venice and the breakfast there was much better by comparison. The hotel is situated in the quiet Dorsoduro area of Venice and this location is a big plus. It is away from the main tourist hotspots so the local bars and restaurants offer better quality and value for money as the neighbourhood caters mainly for locals. Yet the bustling areas of Piazza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge are only a 15-20 min walk away or a few hops on the waterbus from the Ca Rezzonico stop which is 2 minutes from the hotel. Overall, we enjoyed Venice and the Hotel Pausania immensely. If you want a quaint, cosy hotel in a good location, you can't go far wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: banana0411
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. We were on the ground floor in room 150. Arrival: we arrived at the Airport and took the bus to the main bus station in Venice we then walked for about 10 minutes following a map to find the hotel, it was fairly easy to find. You need to have wheely suitcases in Venice as most hotels will require some walking. This one you have a choice to take the water bus or walk direct from the train / bus station. It's very close to academia boat stop. Or Zaterre. For us it made more sence to walk the 10 mins than wait for a boat and walk from the boat stop for 5 mins. The woman who greated us was very friendly and we were made to feel welcome immediately. The hotel courtyard out the front is inviting and very pretty. Room: We were on the ground floor in room 150 we got a great deal on our room price far cheaper than anything else we found in this range on the Center of Venice. Our room was a bit dark and dingy, it was just next to the breakfast room and the courtyard out the back was having building work, so it wasn't a great view. The toilet was small and it was only a half size bath. But the actual room was nice and looks like the pictures. A little small but for what we paid we were happy. It was also handy being on the ground floor as I was pregnant. We did go upstairs and the rooms looked much nicer on the 1st floor and there was a nice sitting area. Breakfast: help yourself to bread, meat, cheese, cereal, juice, croissants, cakes and have the hot chocolate!!!! There was always enough and lots of choice to have something different every day. Very nice. Location: perfect, 15 min walk to st marks, and about 15 mins to realto bridge. The room was quite you can hear the local bells ringing but it didn't wake us. The water bus is 5 mins away. I would recommend a water bus pass we used ours lots and probably saved about Â£100! There are some nice reasonable priced resterants in the road behind particulary the pizza place, with the Hollywood photos! Staff: were really friendly, and helpful. You felt like nothing could trouble them too much. Overall: it was great, overall and excellent value I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Karla020
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a family-room for 4 people, the room was large enough for the four of us. At night is was very quiet. The breakfast buffet was simple; croissants, bread, coffee and machine made orangejuice. The vaporetto is very close (2 stops accademia & Ca' Rezzonico). Walking to San Marco via ponte Accademia takes about 12 minutes. Around the hotel - 2 streets back is a very large square were you can find 2 supermarkets, caffÃ©'s, lovely restaurants and pizzabar al volo were you take away pizza for 1 eur per slice! The square has plenty of banks where you can enjoy the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and great location”
Reviews.Author: mazacoo
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. its in the Uni area of Venice and away from the crowds.And near the famous fruit and vege barge. Staff are really friendly and it is really good value. I'll be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Charming palace with friendly service - for real Venice connoisseurs”
Reviews.Author: HrundiVB
Reviews.Content: The Pausania may not be the grandest palazzo in Venice, not even nearly the most fashionable, not posh, not on the Canal Grande... but it is a lovely, cozy, charming, friendly place for real lovers of Venice in one of the nicest locations possible. You should not opt for this hotel if you are after glamour, hi-tech, shopping, discos, tourist crowds. But if you want a discreet retreat in a location that is not invaded by noisy and ignorant tourists, yet accessible from all sides and at all times - do chose the Pausania. Dorsoduro is real Venice, where in winter you can see grannies in fur coats lugging home their supplies from the nearby fish market or boats selling fresh vegetables, where the waiter in any of the bars close to the hotel will recognize you as you have your morning espresso on your second day. Dorsoduro is definitely not industrial tourism! The hotel may be a little old-fashioned and even slightly dated, the furniture may not be most modern, there is no lift, I doubt if any two rooms are the same (which, after all is to be expected in most of Venice - especially in a hotel whose main building is a 15th century Gothic palazzo), but it is a warm place where one feels welcome. The staff is extremely friendly without being servile. The front desk ladies are classy and helpful. The 1st floor (2nd floor to Americans) sitting area and the small terrace opening onto the canal through carved-stone arches are simply fabulous, as is the very steep and slightly inconvenient but enchanting staircase leading to it. The top-floor room we had was not verry big but it had an alcove with a wardrobe and, more importantly, a second window, both opening onto a pretty little courtyard. Everything was spotlessly clean save for an odd old obstinate stain that would obviously not go away despite all efforts. Breakfast is honest and generous and, although coffee indeed comes from a push button machine (pretty much the standard these days) it is real tasty espresso. Frankly, I do not understand how any reviewer could find anything wrong with breakfast at Pausania (or with almost anything else there, for that matter). Exceptional value for money! We got a really, really good price but it was through a local Venice booking site. Better-known international booking sites were some 20% more expensive. Hotel Pausania is a great base to explore Venice from and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jac Z
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the district of Dorsoduro with many quaint little shops and eating places to explore nearby. There's a delightful gelato shop "GROM" just round the corner that serves divine gelato n hot chocolate! It is a traditional hotel with furniture that is a little aged, but the cleanliness is very well maintained. They have wonderful service personnel at the front desk, all very warm and ready to help. Do note that even though it is mentioned that there is complimentary Internet access under the rooms description, it doesn't mean you are able to access Internet in the room. It just means you have free access to their Internet point, a desktop located in the lobby (there were some technical glitches while I was there). Otherwise Internet is charged at 5 euros per half hour. Another point to note: I visited Venice in the first week of December and many shops were closed. I understood from my hotel personnel that many shop owners usually leave for their own travels during winter.

Reviews.Title: “Charming yet lacks a bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jace23_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my mother. First off, you must note that this is an old palace with high ceilings, window shutters, no elevator and a crooked staircase. We went in may 2011. Already pretty hot outside, we were a bit bummed to hear that they only start putting on the AC in the rooms as of June/July. The windows don't have screens, so beware of friendly birds and the rooms face a courtyard and another building which is very loud. Every hour, you are awaken by a ringing bell a few buildings away. Since there is no elevator, we were forced to carry our heavy suitcases up an old crooked cement staircase..dangerous At night there is nothing to watch on TV but CNN, which gets boring....HOWEVER! This hotel was very beautiful, charming and felt like an authentic hotel in Venice. The bathrooms were accommodating and clean. The room itself was decent and private. They had a beautiful balcony in the upstairs lobby and a space to sit and read. The hotel offered free internet which was very handy and the breakfast was great as well. The hotel itself was in a pretty good location....away from the crowds and the more touristy places, this hotel was located in a quieter, student district, but was basically in the middle of where we wanted to go. In all, it took about a 20 minutes to walk to the Rialto and another 10 to go to St. Marks....but, it went by fast because you observe all the different shops, restaurants and canals along the way. The restos around this hotel are fairly priced, but it can be a bit boring after 9:00pm.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, quiet, lovely piano nobile, Gothic palazzo in Dorsoduro”
Reviews.Author: M D
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Pausania twice; it was recommended to us the first time by a friend who runs a landmark Venetian gallery where Ventians and collectors buy glass. The process of making reservations and selecting a suitable room was greatly facilitated by a willing and helpful staff. Yes, you will find some room walls less than freshly painted and you will find stained carpets, and this can makle a bad impression, but it is old and less expensive than many pallazzi hotels and each year the hotel invests in improvements (all the bathrooms are gleaming new I believe). For example, they are installing even better AC for this summer 2011 I was told, and in August 2009 I found it better than any other hotel iin France or Italy in summer. In winter, it is easy to control the heat to toasty to off, and very quickly. I have never cared for the standard breakfasts in many hotels and just run out to nearby caffÃ©s ... but many people stock up on a fortifying meal at breakfast. Simple but copious. The wifi is not expensive and works well as of Nov 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cru16110
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Pausania for one night. The gentlemen at the front desk was very kind upon our arrival and helpful. All of the staff I encountered were nice. There is not an elevator at this hotel. The room and bathroom were clean. The room was very hot it was only approximately 60 degrees in the day and 50 degree in the night. The breakfast was average bread, meat and cheese. The location is great right in the middle of Venice. I would stay here again, but since I will never stay in Venice not because of the Hotel, but because there really is not much to do, I wont be returning. I was not impressed by Venice one bit, overpriced and over rated. Its a good one day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bbair
Reviews.Content: MARIA at the front desk was not just impolite, but EXTREMELY RUDE! The rooms are terrible, beds uncomfortable, carpets stained... all this for an overpriced fee without wifi included! The neighborhood is great, but do yourself a favor and DON'T STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Way over-priced”
Reviews.Author: Michelle43810
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the hotel, and was very disappointed in the condition of the hotel and the size of the rooms. First night we were placed in a room so small, I could not even open my suitcase on the floor, and because this was our last stop and we were to be there three nights I had hoped to unpack. Also we had to look at a printed mural of horrible-looking wind gods who appeared to be spitting on us from the ceiling. I complained and the night manager told me he could do nothing, I would have to talk to the day manager. We did get moved to a slightly bigger room, but still no place to unpack. At over $ 400.00 a night, it was a rip-off. When I complained that we should not be charged a superior room rate for these obviously NON-SUPERIOR rooms, I was told that we were actually now in a TRIPLE room which cost even more. If that room was a triple, I guess you could have put the third person in the bathroom, but the tub was so tiny he would have had to stand up all night. The upstairs sitting room had great views, but was constantly used by smokers so we were unable to enjoy it. Also it was the poorest breakfast we had in all of Italy and France. Coffee from a push-button machine, and very little choice of fruit, no eggs or hot stuff...stingy with croissants. The pictures in the brochure appear to have been taken when the hotel was in better shape.. The garden is not kept-up and the grass is missing. If you can get a cheap rate, it might be worth it for the quiet location, but full price...steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Yet Charming”
Reviews.Author: evavlau
Reviews.Content: First off, please inquire about the directions to the hotel location, my husband and I are normally good with directions, but seemed to have taken the long route because the information on the website didn't help. Upon arrival you will notice the charming space, you will feel like you just walked into another time. Our room was nice, but please be aware of mosquitoes!!! The rooms are a bit old, the bathroom was more modern than the room. With that being said, we wanted to experience the old so it was what we expected. The continental was good, and the space for dining was very relaxing. The location is a bit further from the main tourist attractions, we enjoyed being away from the tourists, but for those who wish to be closer to the attractions, this may not be the best option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent simple hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rumbers
Reviews.Content: We used our Airmiles for this one, so not sure how much it cost, however, we were very pleased with our choice. The hotel sits on a quiet canal about four minutes' walk (if that) from the Grand Canal in one direction, and about the same in the other direction to the sea/lagoon front. The great thing about it, aside from the location, is the fact that it's really peaceful. Some squares and areas can get very busy, but you don't find many people venturing down this street. For people going to Venice for the first time, it's really easy to get to from the main Piazza Roma (the big transport hub in the north west). We walked, with two small rucksacks and one wheeled case, and it took about 13 minutes. It's probably only 5 minutes from the Vaporetto stop. Walking from the bus terminus, you have to cross over about 4 or 5 small bridges, but it's no big deal with a case. The hotel itself is not magnificent or designer, but is clean, well fitted out, and lovely if you like your history. The wide stone staircase up to the lounge (overlooking the canal) and then up to bedrooms fees very ancient - a bit like the courtyard of a Moroccan Riad(ish). The Maitre'd, Maria, spoke excellent English and was very helpful. It was no problem to leave our bags in reception when we arrived, and then on the day of departure. The room was fine - a bit gloomy (partly because the shutters are often closed to keep out the heat and sun and it looks over the back), but it was clean and comfortable - double bed (two joined together, but firm), big wardrobe, bedside cabinets, TV, aircon and safe. If you're over 6" tall, you'll struggle with the tiny bath/shower - but again - it was clean and fairly newly refurbished. Breakfast was a buffet style, the normal cold meats, cheese, croissants, pastries, cereal etc, with the dining room open to the garden at the rear. All in all, a perfect base for a trip to this wonderful city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the end”
Reviews.Author: Foodyguy51
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated on the canal and we found it easily. The room we were shown to initially was about eight feet square, dingy and pipes sticking out of the wall where a radiator had been. We were very concerned as we had paid around Â£160 per night for this. As I was about to go back to reception the very nice receptionist arrived to apologise for showing us to the wrong room. We were then given the key to the correct room which was on the first floor at the front of the hotel overlooking the canal - unfortunately there was someone still in it - our fault as we had arrived early. The very nice man on reception apologized and suggested we leave our bags and return a little later, which we did. The new room was about four times as large as the first, well decorated and furnished with a great bathroom. The air conditioning was most welcome if a little loud ( I eventually found that I could adjust this). Breakfast was the usual cereal, cooked meat,cheese etc and was taken on the verandah which was very pleasant on a hot morning. There was a lounge with balcony which our room opened onto and it was almost like having a suite. After the initial falter we enjoyed our stay and I must say the staff were very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Air-conditioning didn't work in August!!! Impolite front desk lady!”
Reviews.Author: goldshluger
Reviews.Content: This place was just too expensive for what you get. 120 euros + 10 euros for internet. I would have given this place 3 stars had our air-conditioning worked. I slept with ear plugs because the air-conditioner was so loud and provided minimal cooling(it was too hot to turn it off, even if it only cooled the room slightly). Don't expect a good nights sleep. Breakfast was ok, typical continental breakfast. They had a cappucino machine which was nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “On the canal...near the most happening nighttime entertainment”
Reviews.Author: austinboomerang
Reviews.Content: Staff was exceptionally accommodating and will hold luggage before/after check out for you. The upstairs portion of the hotel where the rooms are located has a large common room where our family of 6 convened for drinks and card games. Wi-fi price was reasonable. Free internet at their provided computer station---very convenient. Map the course from [â€¦] P Roma to the hotel if you intend to carry your luggage; no matter which way you go, you will go over at least 4 bridges. As you approach the hotel, don't be put off by the occasional graffiti and appearance of places being closed up--at no point was there any concern for our safety. Downstairs lounge area (the one near the bar of drinks) had foul odor of raw sewage so we did our meetups in the upstairs lounge area---our only complaint, but forgiven bc we are aware of the ancient sewer system of Venice and its accompanying problems. There is a store very close for sandwiches and drinks. Also, the plaza (P Margerita) looks like a mere fresh fish market by daytime, but by nightime, it is by far the most lively plaza of Venice with wine bars, clubs, restaurants, etc. Very popular with the young and young at heart :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a good spot”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenPerN
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pausania is located in Dorsoduro on the left side of Canal Grande. It is 300 m away from the Water taxi stop and the location offers the "real" Venice with canal, little squares, restaurants etc - but away fromthe most crowded Rialto - St Marcus Square route. Yet a walk to St Marcus is only 10 min. The hotel is in a nice 800 year old Palace, fully renovated with nice spacy rooms (we had a 4 pers family room on the top floor with a fine view). There is a little garden where breakfast is served. The hotel offers everything you need for 2-3 days stay and the 3 stars are perhaps Â½ star too little. Reasonable rates if booked 3-4 month in advance. Service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bunny2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The room was spacious, clean and overlooked the courtyard which was plesant. The room was quiet and hotel was relaxing. A couple of times we had a drink in the lounge area when we got in, which was nice. The breakfast was good and we were happy with the choice. We would happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: raceycasey5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, and barely have any complaints whatsoever. The building itself is just stunning, we loved the stairs. Don't know how much we would have liked carrying a suitcase that was filled with stuff for more than a few days up and down though, but that would be our problem and would not have changed our opinion one little bit. The hotel is situated a really quiet area, but just a minute's walk, if that from a lovely Piazza where you can sit in the evenings and watch the world go by whilst making the most of the table service at Cafe Ai Artisti! Our room was stunning, lovely view over the canal, and beautifully clean. Breakfast was a basic continental, and this is where it dropped from an "excellent" to a "very good". Only because we have had better continental's elsewhere with much better coffee! And the breakfast room, whilst in a lovely setting, was very small for the size of the hotel, and one morning we couldn't get a table so had to go back. The staff were very polite and friendly, and did all they could to help. We would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, best location”
Reviews.Author: rheazeus
Reviews.Content: Other reviews made me wonder if I would regret booking this hotel, but I could not have chosen better. It was easy to walk to from Piazzale Roma (less than 10 mins), I just used google maps satellite image. The hotel is full of character, extremely clean (maid service daily) and so close to everything we wanted to visit. 5 min walk to Traghetto/water bus,10 mins to Peggy Gugenheim, 20 mins to St,Marks.There is a buzz of activity in the evenings but it was far enough away from the 'touristy' area to have a really relaxed feel. It is on one of the prettiest canals where the fruit and veg gondola is located, with lots of great small restaurants in the street behind. Yes, the breakfast is pretty basic (croissants,bread rolls,hams,cheese,fruit,yoghurt,grapefruit/orange juice,big selection of coffee,hot chocolate),but it is more than adequate and you can eat as much as you like.The staff are really helpful and friendly. Ask them about the free Murano trip - it really is free - entrance and water taxi - on the return journey the taxi will drop you wherever you want. Air-con was great and only 1 mosquito in the room (just keep windows closed!).I travel a lot and look for good standards - this was great...you can always find some things to complain about but nothing here would ruin your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Faded grandeur and shabby chic - too faded and shabby?”
Reviews.Author: MazdaGirlBucks
Reviews.Content: This place should be great - great location and an old palazzo that's all faded grandeur and 'shabby chic'. We had a double room at the back for four nights. It was a decent size (I peeped in a couple of others - one smaller and one bigger) with table and chairs, bed was very comfy and lots of coat hangers in the wardrobe. Complementary tea and coffee. Bathroom (with hairdryer) was too small for the 4-piece suite they had squeezed in with a nasty trip-hazard of a step up into it and a chipped sink!!. Bedroom had big window but the shutters had warped so much had to struggle to open/shut them. View of derelict buildings not enticing but the swallows were a wonder to behold and only a couple of mosquitos about. Walls were dirty and needed a fresh coat of paint and the 'murano' chandelier on the ceiling was broken. Entrance lobby looked neglected, as was the garden at the back and the breakfast was basic - stale croissant anyone! We were prepared for the stairs (had only brought hand luggage) which are charming but look as if they won't last much longer (badly repaired). Free internet was useful. Staff were friendly and room was cleaned well every day. Unsure if I'll return - think it was good value (booked with flights through BA) - at about 150 euros at night. Refurbishment and a better breakfast would draw me back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean, reasonable price, but small room”
Reviews.Author: theirresistible
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. It is a cozy little hotel a bit distant from the main attractions (somewhere in the middle of the train station and San Marco), but finding it was not too difficult. And despite the extra water-bus rides and 5 min walk, I liked it coz it was not too touristy. The room was small with tiny TV and refrigerator. The â€œdoubleâ€� bed was the one where they put two-single beds close together and the old air-conditioning was a bit noisy, but it was clean and comfortable enough. And once I got used to the sound of the air-conditioning, it was quiet because there was almost no other sound at all. The bathroom was small, but it still had a bathtub. I liked it because it was kept clean and dry. Our room was on the third floor, and it was not easy climbing up those narrow steps with suitcases. Especially the stone steps linking the ground floor to the second floor were a bit scary at first, and the back of my leather sandals was scraped from coming down the stairs. And there seemed to be no one who could help us with the luggage, so my husband had to carry the two suitcases. (He is still in his twenties and quite athletic, but he was out of breath when we finally got to the room.) The receptionist who greeted us on the first day was cheerful and nice, but there was another lady on the second day that was rather aloof. The breakfast was simple with some bread, ham, cheese, fruits and cereals, but they all tasted good. Overall, I would say it is a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: Xabierferm
Reviews.Content: We go to Venice every year, last February we stayed in Pausiana for 5 nights. We were surprised how good the place is for the money we payed. The hotel is a bit old and there is a bit of damp smell, but this is Venice, believe me you cab feel the same smell in the newest and most expensive hotels in Venice. The staff were very friendly and professional, specially Mario from reception. I highly recommend this hotel to everybody

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: HB62
Reviews.Content: This could be a great hotel as the location is great and it is a beautiful building but the lobby is dingy with shabby furniture and worn carpets. The room we had which was billed as a quadruple was just a double with two beds squeezed in. We had one wardrobe with six hangers and two small shelves as storage for four people. The breakfast was served in a nice room overlooking a garden which could have been lovely but was untended and scruffy. Breakfast was the most basic I have had in a hotel for a long time. This hotel could be brilliant but is just OK and certainly not value for money. On the plus side a great location right next to a pretty canal and near lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Dorsoduro”
Reviews.Author: ckstar16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pausania at the end of March/beginning of April 2011. The property was once the residence of an aristocratic Venetian family, so the hotel reminded me of a historic bed and breakfast. The hotel is easy to find from the vaporetto stop of Ca' Rezzonico. It is located in the Dorsoduro district away from the mainstream of tourists but within walking distance to all major attractions. There are plenty of local restaurants and shops in the area so there is no need to stray far at night. The service at the front desk was exceptional. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The language barrier was never a problem. Ask for your free welcome drink at 7pm the night you arrive. We found the rooms to be comfortable and clean. The decor could use some updating, but it added to the charm of the hotel. Travelers should note that there is no elevator. The old staircase might be a problem for those who canâ€™t climb steps or those with a lot of luggage. A continental breakfast is included in the price of the room. We found the food to be typical of the other Italian hotels: bread, croissants, meats and cheeses, yogurt, and cafÃ©/juice/tea. The breakfast space overlooks the courtyard, which is lovely. There is a computer in the lobby with free internet access. What a perk! Overall, I would stay here again. It was a quiet and charming little hotel in the heart of the beautiful Dorsoduro district.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Neighborhood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PRGNYC
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in Dorsoduro to be close to the venue of the purpose of my trip, so this hotel fit the bill. True, it is in a converted palazzo and therefore has no elevator, but even the double flight of stone steps couldn't detract from its charm. The upstairs siting room is spacious and inviting, with access to the standing balcony for those who need to sneak a smoke. I stayed 6 nights, and the first night I had a double room with no window but a large skylight. I flunked skylight opening, so was much better off with my single room with window for the rest of my stay. I actually found the arrangement and appointment of the single room preferable to the double. Accommodating staff, nice breakfast space, free internet and a few of guest rooms on the ground floor for those who can't take the stairs. I'd stay here again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “small friendly hotel, close to local attractions and vaporetti waterbus stop”
Reviews.Author: mimnagh
Reviews.Content: Small friendly hotel, close to local attractions. 5 min walk to Ca'Rezzonico vaporetti stop. local restaurants within easy walking distance. Staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet fresh and plentiful served in a conservatory overlooking garden. Hotel was very warm and cosy despite cold weather outside.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hywel_dyer
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel. Full of character. Continental breakfast very good. Hotel clean, warm & pleasant in a good location & easy to find. Staff friendly & helpful. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificento!”
Reviews.Author: Ronpowers
Reviews.Content: We called from Verona and received excellent directions and instructions about how to reach the hotel. We arrived to the hotel and was welcomed with a warm reception and the decor of our room. The room was cozy and overlooked a small garden. The receptionist recommended excellent restaurants and places to visit. Although, we stayed only for one night, it was a great night and a highlight of my trip to Italy. Venice is a beautiful city on the water that is teaming with stunning architecture and history.

Reviews.Title: “Great no frills hotel, local neighbourhood but easy access to sights”
Reviews.Author: Markbu Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value and pleasant hotel, breakfast fine and in great locale - Campo Santa Margherita is a local area close to the University, so 'real' Venice, but at the same time close to all the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Your money and your life”
Reviews.Author: PaulLucida
Reviews.Content: Hotal Pausania, Venice Flight to Venice from Heathrow a mere 100 minutes. 20 mins more from airport to bus/vaporetto (public water bus) terminus, thence a stately ride down the Grande Canal, to the pier stop ( Caâ€™Rezzonico) just five minutes walk from the hotel. As the hotel stay was a departure from my chosen Venice itinerary, this required a Google search and sundry TripAdvisor advice some days prior to departure. Under â€œVeniceâ€� 400 hotel options presented themselves in ascending (or descending, your choice) order of both popularity and price. Finally I chose one on the basis, of its proximity to the Grande Canal and to my guides to be (more about them in a minute), tucked up a tiny linking waterway boasting a single lonely gondolier and the cityâ€™s most photographed fruit and vegetable stall. One Hotel Pausania. An internet booking of 150 Euros for two nights appeared reasonable on the face of it, at least until I arrived. After a severe scramble up thirty-two drunkenly positioned stairs, an extremely narrow and stuffy room confronted me, boasting one slim and unyielding single bed. Not at all what I had in mind. So down the stairs to open up negotiations with the lady on the desk, who said that there would be no problem about an upgrade, just a matter of a few additional euros. (Funny how a language barrier seems to dissolve away when it comes to matters of money). Well we opened negotiations around 300euros and ended up nearer 200euros after a lot of continental hand-gestures from myself, and this was finally agreed by the aforementioned cashier. Just as Jan Morris says in her great book â€œVeniceâ€�, the Venetians are hard and experienced negotiators and you take them on at your peril! All I will say additionally about this particular watering hole, is that after stumbling on and off planes, coaches and river boats with two substantial suitcases, the Hotel Pausania presented you with one final and inescapable obstacle: the wonky step assault- course for the knee-challenged. True, I had been up and down these same thirty-two steep and crooked four hundred year old marble steps twice already, but not with the burden of two large cases. So I politely inquired of the now considerably richer lady behind the desk if there might possibly be someone who might assist with maneuvering my baggage in an upward direction? That is towards my recently negotiated larger room? A slight head movement: No; nyet; nein, a negative whichever way you cut it. So with teeth grinding on an assortment of ageing dental work, I struggled twice more (one journey for each case) up the highly polished and undoubtedly lethal marble risers. Arrival at the top step for the third time felt akin to a successful assault on Annapura. But do check out the accompanying photograph and be warned, and if like me and other ex-hill walkers and long distance runners you have a touch of gyp in the knee, avoid the Pausania at all costs. Even with forewarning, and the invocation of doctorâ€™s advice on four continents, the result was still the same on departure three days later when asking for help with the cases: no, nyet, nein!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nothingcomestomind
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Hotel Pausania is the canal side location within walking distance of all the major sights. The hotel is a typical mid-range European city hotel with small rooms but perfectly adequate for a City break. Breakfast was what we expected - warm croissants, jams, yogurt, salami, cheese and bread rolls. Coffee and juice is from a drinks dispensing machine. We found it a great base with the bonus of some great trattorias in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is a Gem”
Reviews.Author: fand
Reviews.Content: As a guidebook puts it, this hotel is a gem. We just got back from four nights at the Hotel Pausania and we enjoyed our stay very much. Our room was nice and big, and we loved our view of the canal. We also loved the free breakfast in the mornings, which included warm croissants (yum!), rolls, cereal, yogurt, fruit, salami and ham, cheese, juice, coffee, etc. We walked to everything, including the Rialto Bridge, St. Markâ€™s, and dinner every night. The front desk staff were very helpful, especially in arranging a water taxi for us on our last morning when we needed to get to the airport. One thing to be aware of, as other reviewers have already written, you have to climb a big (and slanty) stone staircase to get to the rooms. The staircase is beautiful and charming but if you have a problem climbing stairs, this is not the hotel for you. Hotel Pausania is a charming hotel, and if I return to Venice I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful old hotel situated in the real Venice away from tourists”
Reviews.Author: JaneMay
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly as portrayed - only drawback the steep old stairs to rooms, but they had warned us adequately. Comfortable room, lovely surroundings and the staff were fluent in English and went out of their way to be helpful. They recommended excellent local restaurants frequented by locals and not tourists. We avoided the crowds around St Mark's Square and saw Venice life from a water bus - with a cheap 36 hour ticket. We got on where everyone got off so got seats with a view. There was shopping, deliveries, old off shoots from the canal - even a funeral. And we saw all the historic sites from a distance. Then we walked to our boat in San Basilio - the hotel advised against a water taxi and it saved us a lot of money and was so easy.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!-Achtung! A single is not a double room! Make sure you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Broccante
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have visited Venice at least 8 times in the last 10 years, so we know what to expect. We took my sister and husband (first visit to Europe) to Venice. I booked through an independant website - but called the hotel to verify the 2 DOUBLE rooms and was reassured by MARIA at the reception. We checked in at 10pm and was very DISAPPOINTED at how small our room was. I didn't want to ruin the magic of Venice for my family, so didn't complain about it to them. The 2nd night, I happed to check the floor plan posted on the wall and guess what??? Our room was a SINGLE ROOM which was sold to us a DOUBLE ROOM. No wonder we had to jump over our suitcase to get to the bathroom. It was too late to do anything since were were checking out the next morning - but I wanted to make a point of mentioning it. Someone else beat me to it. An Italian lady was expressing her dissatisfaction for the same thing and she booked it direct and also reconfirmed via phone before arrival. This leads me to suspect that they do this on purpose knowing they have a captive audience and visitor's time is limited. CONCLUSION: this kind of behaviour gives Venice a bad reputation and I'm sure the Guardia di Finanza wouldn't be too pleased either.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DEAL”
Reviews.Author: PortoAlegre
Reviews.Content: Nice place, nice room, nice breakfast, nice building!

Reviews.Title: “good impression”
Reviews.Author: Ekaterina_M
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very well situated for our needs, value for money was good as well, the room was a bit small but clean and well decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travellerLisse
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated outside the normal tourist location in Dorsoduro and yet very covenient - easy to reach by vaporetto. Close to Campo Santa Margherita, Gallerie dell' Accademia and Collecione Peggy Guggenheim. Room was small but clean and a nice view to the canal. Good breakfast in the morning and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Getting even better - again”
Reviews.Author: JohnAndrews
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned last night from our sixth stay at the Hotel Pausania and once again were delighted with the reception we received. We last visited just under a year ago and since then some more improvements have been made (and we thought it excellent before!) - the stairs have a handrail (good for those of us approaching retirement age), the room had a safe, a kettle was provided in the room for those essential late night coffees and we were even provided with slippers! What more could you ask? This really is a great hotel in a marvellous district near a really lively square with its shops and restaurants and crowds of perfectly behaved young people enjoying life. There is an energy about this district that is infectious. We won't leave it long before once again booking a room in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: AngieSmits
Reviews.Content: This old hotel is in a great neighborhood of excellent restaurants, markets, coffee and gelato. The room was very nice, breakfast typical for this type of hotel, and there was a balcony that overlooked the canal. That was an especially lovely place. The stairway to the second floor is outside, though covered, and added to the charm of the place, as did the inner courtyard. As Venice is small, you are close to the things you need to be close to.

Reviews.Title: “Every traveller should enjoy the Venice Carnival at least once.”
Reviews.Author: Italienophile
Reviews.Content: The stay was delightful: the tasteful refurbishment of this 14th century palazzo set the tone nicely for the carnevale events nearby, in the piazzas, streets and churches. The many students around were lively and well-behaved, the architecture interesting. Although the focus of the main celebrations was inevitably St Mark's square, we enjoyed the events more local to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: Sixtynewforty
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Venice on 25th September, my 60th Birthday. (Tip 1: check out the excellent web site www.europeforvisitors.com/venice) The trip was a present from my wife so we were looking for a pleasant, romantic location to base our 5 day stay in Venice. Hotel Pausania did not let us down. Located in the quiet residential area of Dorsoduro by a canal Hotel Pausania is a real gem. Modern facilities in a "14th century Venetian palace" and welcoming staff it is the ideal base to see Venice. A 5 minute walk from Vaperetto ( line N1 )stop Ca Rezzonico on the Grande Canal,connects to all the main places of interest including Piazza San Marco and Rialto Bridge. From Marco Polo airport we caught the Alilaguna ( water bus) to Zattere. This is a pleasant 75 minute ride and cost 12 euro.(Tip 2: if you want to pay by card buy it at the Alilaguna Kiosk) It's about a ten minute walk to the hotel, and was easy to find. Honest! We had a map which they gave us with the Alilaguna tickets and used for the duration of our stay. Some of the negative reviews on Hotel Pausania are way off base. Yes you do get mosquittos. It's Venice, warm climate by the water for heavens sake. ( Tip 3 buy a mosquitto repellent for the room, and spray for yourself) The breakfast is a good start for the day and is served overlooking the garden. The staff are friendly , and on arrival we had a bottle of sparkling wine delivered to our room to celebrate my 60th. The best way to enjoy Venice is just to walk around and just hop on or off the vaporetto (water bus) A 3 day pass was 31 euros, and well worth it.. The nearby Campo (square)Santa Margherita has a market in the early morning and in the evening transforms into a vibrant place frequented by the students. Campo Santo Stefano situated the other side of the Grande Canal via the Ponte D. Accademia is a good place to watch life go by, and a stop off , if your walking to the Piazza San Marco. When we visited in late September there were lots of concerts advertised, many of them in churches. These we highly recommend. Listening to Vivaldi's Four Seasons one evening in a church was a lasting memory. We went to 3 concerts ( one free!)all of them spontaneous. we just happened to be passing the church at the time. A big thank you to Hotel Pausania for contibuting to a fantasic memorable stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Cruise Terminal”
Reviews.Author: SherlockTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to joining a cruise out of Venice to Rome. The hotel was chosen for it's close proximity to the cruise liner terminal, where we departed for our Windstar cruise. Excellent location for the cruise terminal, we managed to walk it in approx 5-10 mins, trundling 2 large cases & 2 back packs..not bad although we were helped on the final bridge over to the cruise terminal by a very helpful porter. I wouldn't recommend the short walk though unless you are relatively ok with negotiating 2 bridges (incl.bridge by terminal) - I am in my 40's, partner early 50's and we were fine, even though the temperature was well into the 30's. The hotel is easily reached via the number one vaporetto which runs along the Grand Canal & was a short 5 min. walk from our stop Ca' Rezzonico. The number one vaporetto & all the vaporetto's we travelled on during our trip were very busy - think a little bit uncomfortable/squashed when you have luggage with you. The hotel itself was located on a quiet canal just off a small square, complete with a church and a few gondolas. Hotel is a small, quaint & intimate old building with a pretty little open courtyard containing a noticeably wonky ,original stone staircase which we would climb to access our room, The decor was rather tired and the bed a little uncomfortable, but the bathroom was nice & clean so all things considered it was adequate for a 3 star hotel. The breakfast was typical continental and was served in a pleasant room open to a small garden where you could watch the little birds looking for some small crumbs to eat - they were quite entertaining. There is also a wonderful canal boat selling fruit etc just along from the hotel, it's very colourful and apparently the most photographed fruit stall in Venice. Staff were very helpful & quite pleasant. Hotel has real potential if it was given a bit of a refurb., but no real complaints it was in a great location & we had a pleasant stay. A few tips would be to shop around if you want to do a gondola ride - the prices vary quite a bit. We were quoted Â£120 euros by one guy located by St Marks Square - we then walked approx 50 metres along in front of the Doges Palace & managed to get a prettier gondola and more affable gondolier for 80 euros. The gondolier right by the hotel Pausania quoted 100 euros when asked. Also be a little wary of being asked to sign petitions by people asking you to come sign at a table laid out in our case within the square next to the hotel - be aware that after you have signed they will want a cash donation i.e. minimum 10 euros!!! We flew into Treviso airport and caught an Atvo bus into Venice - the Atvo desk is located in the airport terminal and tickets are approx 6 euros per person, buses are timed for the flights arriving so very efficent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, staff so-so”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellor12345
Reviews.Content: Just got back. Stayed two nights for 180 euros a pop. Expensive, considering the exchange rate, but the location was perfect. It's a residential area of Venice, just down the block from the Grand Canal and perfect spot. The hotel is really neat building. Built in the 1400s - so it's got amazing character. The steps going up really slope to one side, for example. The staff could have been nicer - whatever info we got from them we asked for - they never would have told us about breakfast. But that's the only downside. The room we stayed in was nice - clean, average size, decent sized bathroom, etc. Breakfast was fine, too. But when you go to Venice, you're not going for the room or the breakfast or the hotel staff - you're going to see Venice - and this hotel's location made it worth our while. We'd go back there...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, lovely quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Salsagirl77
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old daugher and i stayed at the Pausania during carnevale time. the hotel was clean, very warm and cosy and the staff were very helpful. The hotel was easy to find 5 minutes from the Ca Rezzonnico vaporetto stop, it is in a quiet residential area of Venice (the dursodoro) The lounge area was stunning but also comfortable and the room and bathroom was very clean and of reasonable size. This hotel was handy for visiting all areas of venice and was 5-10 minutes from Accademia bridge, Accademia gallery and the Peggy Guggenheim collection. the only issue maybe that for the those who have small children the stone staircase(external) was tilted slightly and was slightly difficult to walk down until you got used to it (my daughter had no problem after 3 days) we would definitely choose this hotel if we were returning to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: EMSScotland
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights in the Hotel Pausania. From the photos on the hotel's website, we expected our bedroom (admittedly we booked a 'standard' and not a 'superior' room) to be of a reasonable size, light and attractively decorated and furnished. Instead, it was small, verging on poky, dark and - as another reviewer on this webite has commented - the walls were covered in dirty marks and stains where previous visitors had swatted mosquitos - truly disgusting! We had a choice of leaving the windows and shutters closed, in which case the room quickly became stuffy - and was also rather dark - or opening the windows and letting in the mosquitos - both my partner and I received several bites. The breakfasts were adequate but nothing special; the staff were generally civil until we came to pay the bill when the receptionist quibbled with my partner about drinks from the mini-bar, clearly implying that he was lying about the number of drinks we had consumed. When she found she was wrong, she ungraciously failed to apologise. Add to all this the fact that we paid about Â£520 for the privilege of staying in this place, and my advice to fellow travellers is - give it a wide berth! The only saving grace is that Dorsoduro is an attracttive and relatively quiet part of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here”
Reviews.Author: BeenthereChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: A nightmare. Hotel is extremely difficult to find. Even shop owners could not direct us. Upon arrival we were told we had been "upgraded" to an apartment. This was a dumpy place in an alley behind the hotel. Apartment was on the 2nd floor and a 5-gallon tank of gasoline and several large auto batteries were on the stairwell-not very comforting. I told the desk about the gasoline and they responded it would be moved, but when we returned from dinner at 10:00 pm, it was still on the stairs and because it was the property of the other apartment, couldn't be moved. We should have left as soon as we saw this place, but had spent 30 minutes dragging our suitcases over the canal bridges and it was for only one night. Don't go here. I never saw any of the locations in the hotel shown in the photos except for the well at the entrance. Makes me think they were taken elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: AlWitney
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Hotel Pausania directly from the hotel via email, we recieved very informative replies in good English, they even tried to save us money on the rooms by inviting us to pay by cash upon arrival to save on the commision by paying with credit card, although we were not comfortable about doing this as we were staying for 7 days and it was alot of money to carry around. This was the first leg of a 2 week stay in Italy for our honeymoon and having read all the bad reviews we were slightly apprehensive as to what we would expect. It started well with the hotel booking us a water taxi a couple of days previously for which we paid for on arrival, when we landed in Venice we phoned the hotel and they were very helpful in telling us the exact direction to get the taxi. When we arrived we checked in with very little fuss and we made our way up to our room (no lift but it is typical of the older buildings in Venice) we specifically requested a room with a view of the canal outside during our correspondence and again we weren't disappointed, the view onto the Rio di San Barnaba was wonderful, the only disappointment was that it didnt have a balcony and that we couldnt enjoy it more by sitting out instead having to lean out of the window, but we quickly got over that as we didnt come to Venice to sit in our hotel room! We were shattered after our flights and a 5.30a.m start so we had a sleep for a couple of hours, very peacful and not too much outside noise, when we woke we unpacked only to discover that we had forgotten our toothpaste, we asked down at reception where we could go out and get some and he told us not to worry and gave us his, very kind. Every day we experienced courtesy from the staff and they were very helpful in giving us directions to various places, they even gave us help on our Italian pronunciation, sheets and towels were changed every day without asking, the rooms are clean and well presented with air conditioning (use this rather than opening the windows - mosquitoes!) The breakfast is very basic, the coffee was weak (but thats only because I like very strong coffee) and there was no fresh fruit which we would have expected, basic but you didnt leave the table feeling hungry. Having read previous reviews, I would however have to agree on a couple of things that people raised, that the hotel is expensive for what you get and that its quite shabby inside, firstly, this is Venice and everythings expensive so we knew exactly what to expect before we left, and secondly, yes it is shabby, but again this is Venice and all the buildings are old and therefore prone to a bit of wear and tear, to us it just added to the character of the place, shabby but very definitely clean throughout. All in all, it is a fabulous hotel with plenty of charm with helpful and friendly staff, dont expect too much from the hotel itself in terms of activity but consider it a clean, fairly central and moderately priced base to explore the very unique city of Venice

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely time here”
Reviews.Author: londontravellers-7
Reviews.Content: Having read some negative reviews for Hotel Pausania, we thought we'd write one commending the hotel. We've just enjoyed a 4 day break in Venice and were very pleased with our choice - Dorsoduro is a quiet, pretty part of the city and the neighbouring Campo Santa Margherita offers many bars and cafes. The hotel has a good location for sightseeing and was moderately priced. We slept well as our room was so dark and quiet at night, and the bathroom was very clean. We found the staff friendly and we really enjoyed the breakfast every morning.It seems that the hotel has improved (we were surprised to read the previous reviews) and we would happily recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pausania Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Venice, Italy. It is such an amazing city and we especially liked the Dorsoduro neighborhood, which is less touristy and full of great restaurants and beautiful churches and museums. The only problem we had with our trip was the Hotel Pausania which is very overpriced for its value, needs attention (rooms can be dark and musty), and most notably, the staff was downright rude and unprofessional. In our experience, Venetians are generally very friendly hosts, but the concierges at this hotel barely said hello and were actually patronizing and rude when we had a misunderstanding about the bill. Also, compared with other hotels in the same price range (where friends were staying) the breakfast is so-so. This really is not a four or even three star hotel in anyway except the expense. Venice has so many great little hotels in the Dorsoduro section, do not stay at the Pausania!

Reviews.Title: “very poor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The walls in our room were dirty, covered with the blood and bodies of squashed mosquitoes. Bearing in mind we stayed in February, not exactly the height of mosquito season, these stains must have been there for months. What was more serious was the attiude of the staff. As we had an early departure we gave reception 24 hours notice and asked them if they could arrange some breakfast. We were told that this would be ok. On the morning of our departure when we went downstairs for breakfast we were treated absolutely despicably and extremely rudely by the man who was then on duty. There had been no effort to make sure that there was any breakfast and it was all too much trouble for him. We virtually had to beg for some orange juice which he reluctantly gave to us but acted as if we had made an unreasonable request. There was no bread so we asked for two small yoghurts instead which he dumped on the side with such force that one fell on the floor. We have never received this kind of treatment in any hotel anywhere in the world and we travel a lot. We emailed our complaint to the hotel on our return to the UK and still haven't heard anything back. This is obviously an indication of their general lack of care.

Reviews.Title: “Not one to return to.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel is in a beautiful position in a delightful part of Venice we had an awful experience at Hotel Pausania. We had asked the hotel to pre book our water taxi from the hotel. On arrival at the airport the taxi wasn't there so we had to arrange our own way. On arrival at the hotel the staff were very rude and kept interrupting; they were not prepared to listen to us and insisted on charging us for a service we didn't get. We had a superior room, but it was hardly superior,it was very cold with very poor heating. Breakfast was poor, stale rolls and out of date yoghurt. There was nothing to suggest the staff wanted us to stay at their hotel. We visit Venice every year but would not stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Pausania
HotelInfo.Address: 2824 Dorsoduro, 30123 Venice, Italy
